reviews.text: Very nice castle. I would recommend to walk up there, there are different possibilities and each has a nice view over the city. You can walk around the castle along the castle walls. You can also go up on top of the wall to have a nice view to the north, if the weather is good you can see the alps. In the south you'll find the big tower, you need a ticket top go up there.

A great place for your every day tourist. Nice panorama view of the city, good shops.
But if you are looking for any kind of medieval experience or real history, historical museum, artifacts, whatever, then this is not it; except maybe there are some castle related events from time to time.
A fun funicular ride and equally fun walking trails.

Great views of the city! The whole Castle is well organized as a museum and has a restaurant+cafe, however I didn't order anything so I can't tell you about the service and/or food. You can enjoy the views without paying for the museum experience.
Frequently there are outdoor screenings of popular films.
They have a law that nothing can be built higher than the castle, so you can easily use it to find your way around the city.

Good, nice castle views too. Virtual Castle Tour is a good, but quick history lesson. Tickets were cheap, and the way down even cheaper. However, the seasonal art exhibition was laughable and the puppet museum didn't feel relevant to the castle. Also, even though it's nice, it's a shame to see that the interior of the castle has lost some of its charm due to how modernised it's become.

Nice place with views of Ljubljana and 2 good restaurants. There is a cablecar going up from Ljubljana centre or you can drive up with a car. Great to spend some quality time while visiting Ljubljana.
It's a wall. If you haven't seen Roman ruins integrated into everyday life before, go see it, but otherwise don't go out of your way.
Calm small piece in centre of the city with feeling of history.

This is the location of the southern fortifications wall of Roman city Emona, nowadays Ljubljana, capital of Slovenia. In the 1920s the city authorities wanted to remove the ruins, but the most famous Slovenian arhitect Jože Plečnik  the architect of this city quarter's renovation - and conservator France Stele - project initiator - managed to change their minds. The wall was renovated and changed a bit with the addition of a pyramid and columns at the south city gate. Emona was built between the years 35 bc and 14-15 ad when these fortifications were finished.
To those uneducated the walls might seem not significant because the conditions of it not being destroyed were to lay it in the city plans in such a ways that it would not obstruct the traffic and city development and growth in any kind. So it is 'put' in this surrounding in most in kind of a 'hidden from a view' way...
There are to gateways, the east one is exactly the original main south gateway of Emona and is decorated with columns added by Plečnik, they were not there originally. Between them is a pyramid, which is interesting, but a kind of a mistake of Plečnik, because pyramids were not really a Roman thing, but Plečnik liked them. The small park running along the walls was also planned by plečnik. It's quite nice, because in half of a minute you can hide away from the main streets and hot summer sun to a quite place, sit down and relax.

As a wall conniseur, I found this to be lacking in any substance with poor structural stability. How it is managed to stay up for what 50 years? is beyond me. I get the feeling that this is the kind of workmanship that caused the downfall of the roman empire. 2/10, would not recommend to other wall enthusiasts.

Visit this if you happen to be nearby. It is pleasant and quiet, yet only minutes from city center. There is some old Roman architecture, as well as some newer architecture (a pyramid) integrated into it. A few signs are there to educate you.

If you like a more alternative style this is totally the place for you. The artwork is absolutely amazing! The bars are unique and the vibe is awesome. If you want to be alone it's totally feasible, especially during the day, but if you want company, people are very friendly.

This community is super cool full of art that can get some inspiration from it! You will be amazed by how delicate how creative the work is, in the meanwhile, the material they use, the color they match is quite particular! I can say I visited to this city one big reason is for this community, and better with your camera with you as some part is quite dark for phone!

An interesting place inside the city, and pretty close to the train main station. 
It's one of three tiny independent spots inside three European capitals. My aim to visit the other two and just compare how each one of these has started, developed, and what kind of challenges they have to continue being existed. In case of Metelkova, the government already did many attempts to clean the place and bring the settlers out, but they were obviously unsuccessful.

Absolutely gorgeous exhibition of street art and a great place to wander around. You could spend hours here taking in every available detail on the walls and buildings all around you. Additionally the location of Metelkova seemed to inspire general street art so make sure to wander through the entire area and not just this.
Really cool, just know that people smoke there, but usually they understand this is a touristic place. I love the art here

A cute but small zoo. Good for an afternoon trip.

Has loads of interactive amenities with a new animal every now and then. 

In 2019 they got two new Lions, which is quite exciting.

A beautiful zoo, animals are well cared for and have nice enclosures. It's not a big zoo, but it has nice pathways, with loads of shadow for hot summer days. There are a few nice playgrounds for the children and a petting zoo. There is one restaurant in the middle of the zoo. Also next to the zoo are new bathrooms and changing room for mothers with small children, which are very clean. The only downside is the parking area over the weekends when there is a lot of visitors, but easy to park during the week. Note that the zoo is closed on mondays.

Great zoo with much to see. It also has a new addition of Lions. The Zoo is located in the forest so it is  great for those hot days as you walk in the shade. I would say it is an experience for a half a day and you can see anything from animals that live in Slovenia and many that don't (tigers, monkeys, elephant, and many more). There are also a lot of activities for children and a place to eat.

Once a year we go to Ljubljana ZOO. Lots of animals. Lots of playgrounds for children. Petting ZOO. There should be more trashcans. ZOO parking should be bigger and employee should direct cars. Parking is free of charge (thump up). Entry fee is reasonable. It is animal friendly. They expanded a lot since last year.

Not the biggest of zoo-s, but a very neat one - the animals seem to be taken good care of (I've been there the first time after many years, but intend to return). The cages vere enlarged since many years ago. It is placed in beautiful surroundings of a city park (more like forrest) so it offers a nice walk either on sun or in the shade. It also has very inventive and fun playgrounds.
Off the beaten track, this museum offers great shows around contemporary design & architecture.
Good museum, but small.
Cool building, great exhibits
Krasen in zanimiv muzej z veliko kulturno dediščino. Vredno ogleda. Priporočam.
Študentske razstave so vedno kul za pogledat.
Off the beaten track, this museum offers great shows around contemporary design & architecture.
Good museum, but small.
Cool building, great exhibits
Krasen in zanimiv muzej z veliko kulturno dediščino. Vredno ogleda. Priporočam.
Študentske razstave so vedno kul za pogledat.

Are you a lover of modern art of all mediums? Are you interested in Slovenian artists and the inspiration behind their works? If so, this museum is not to be missed. There are many interesting paintings, sculptures, video artworks, and other curiosities. If you are squeamish about you or your children seeing nudity, this gallery may not be your cup of tea. But if you are comfortable seeing a few naked body art works sprinkled in with the other art work, do stop by. The museum has a downstairs coffee bar/lounge and lecture hall for talks.  I really enjoyed the museum and its art works.

Half of the space is permanent exhibition and other half is actual and temporary, usually open three times a year for a few months; always interesting topic. 
Otherwise calm and chilly space, where time and thoughts run slower tempo.

I was left speechless. The exhibits are so beautifully pieced together that it is almost impossible to peel your eyes off them. You will need about an hour to go through the whole gallery, after which you can relax in the cafè bellow the gallery itself. The gallery also provides a student discount, so be sure to bring your students' card!

Beautiful bulging and interesting permanent collection. You will need 30 minutes-1 hour to see it all. The temporary exhibition space is big and well organised. The thicket costs only 5 euros: an extra reason to have this insight into modern Slovenia. Visit the coffee downstairs if you have a little time.
One of my favourite places in Ljubljana to have a nice cup of coffee or tea and stay close to modern art. Highly recommended.
For me, this is the best museum in Europe. So many fantastic works of art.
Don't waste your time. The gallery is almost empty. Go to the national museum.
Short and sweet narrative of Bangkok fine arts.
Great exhibition. Especially, Marsis great paintings.
Definitely worth a visit! Intriguing artwork, and I think I literally spent hours there.
Too many people in the Open Door day and no real chance to see everything in peace and details. Otherwise the exhibitions seem pretty interesting
Very nice collection of Ancient and Medieval life in Slovenia.
Place where you can see some unique features on the globe.
Very detailed and interesting, well worth a visit and the entrance fee is €4 per person.
Great exhibition! The gold of Chinese emperors.
Excellent look in Slovenia through the 20th century

This museum used to be a museum with strong political impact. In the recent years it lost a bit of this historical patina, but influence of the past regime is still in the air. Museum is interesting and worth visiting particularly for foreigners interested in socialism. I like the car in front of the museum.

Very good exhibition. Learnt a lot about Slovenian history, especially during WWII from this exhibition. Also loved the section which shows Slovenian history through the decades (the 70s toys & gadgets were very nostalgic!)
Very interesting museum site also used as a conference venue, poor restrooms
Excellent way to learn about Slovenian history

A very nice museum with seasonal exhibits. Had the chance to spend part of my afternoon here and were able to see how details were carefully taken in consideration, specially with a good translation of all the content to English. The space was very well used to fit in a couple of exhibits and the cafe just at the museum’s doorstep was a nice touch.
Some is very interesting, some is not so much. Buy a pleasant experience overall.
Very interesting :) Waiting this year for 32 grafic bienale:)
It has great exhibitions.
Went for a walk in the park and had a very nice drink in the cafe on a beautiful sunny day. What’s not to like ...
Was pretty good. Better places to eat though. Horse was interesting to eat and the burgers were huge.
Okay food, i was not that impressed but it was good.
Horse meat is OK, but addatives and bread are horrible. Would love some home maid source and more vegetables to freshen up the burger.
The best horse burger in the country. Must try. 👏👏👏
It use to be the best burger in town.. Now it is like plastic...
The kebab staff were REALLY REALLY FRIENDLY and made our day with his enthusiasm. The chicken kebab was very delicious with extremely generous portions! HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!!!!
Friendly stuff indeed. Always worth the visit if you don't like huge crowds.
Very nice kebab and it opens till late. Great place for a late night snack.
Very good food. It's a little bit more expensive but the food is worth it's price.
Great fast service, very kind people
Great service, still great pancakes. Zombie cocktail was missing sugar to cover alcohol taste but it was still really good.
Food excellent and the service top class ....also set in a idyllic place on the river. Great for a lazy lunch.
One of the best salads we ever had.
One of the best pancakes i have ever eaten, try them!
Small and cosy place. Good kitchen. Nice for quiet dinner.

The location is great, the food is great (although the level of spiciness can vary at times, probably due to different chefs or cooks). My long time favorite is probably the chicken with cashews, but other things like pad thai or egg noodles are also really great. All in all, it's a great choice if you want to have lunch in the city. Not sure if they have vegan options tho.

The food is excellent, but all of your clothes smell like Chinese food after you exit the restaurant.
Two stars because their food is so good, otherwise we'd be at one; I wish they would fix their ventilation.

The restaurant offers a mix of Chinese, Japanese and Thai food. I had the chance to try four quite different dishes and was enjoying all of them - both the mild and the spicy ones. They offer starters, main dishes and deserts, as well as some great self made teas. The location has a nice feeling, the waiters are friendly and the pricing is moderate or sometimes a bit higher.

Beeeeeaaautiful food. Except the starter that’s why I’ve marked them down one.

I got the curried chicken cakes and they were literally not curried at all. They were just greasy patties with lemon grass in. I have been to thailand before and to be fair to them they tasted like they do on the street markets but I didn’t like them either.

The main course I got the yellow chicken curry as well as the chicken fried rice (which is a massive portion so is actually a main rather than a fancy side). I wish I took photos but I dived in like the animal I am. The curry was beautiful and the chicken fried rice was even better. They use so much veg which is amazing and gives it such a good colour.

Honestly so good. I couldn’t eat it all but they packaged it up for us so we had it in bed later on after a few drinks. Winner winner.

I ordered a Cuba Libre and it was pants. So don’t recommend that particular cocktail! Didn’t taste like it had alcohol in and they used crushed ice which was a bit naff.

One of the best Asian restaurant in Ljubljana. The waiters are very nice. Quick service. Good food. Large portion size of food. 
Great place if you like spicy food. 
There is a WiFi connection, nice large toilets and you can pay by card.

Everything is perfect here except almost no vegetarian choices. But the decoration, interior, service, complimentary bread (served in warm!) with basil sauce are perfect. Price is reasonable, big proportion main dishes cost 7-12€, value for money for its service and quality. It was full house and local love it for gathering. Cozy place which u can sit a night here. The cream cake tastes nice too though the form is different than the one from Bled. Recommended

Fantastic food. Not many vegetarian options but the few they had were amazing. Good service, the toasted cheese and the vegetable 'cake' were delicious. The salad was ok, it was large but overwhelmed by leafy lettuce. Beer was nice. Would come back, especially if I were a meat-eater.
Great restaurant with a lot of recognition. Food is very good, wine also. Recommended if you are around it.
Great place and good staff. Food was delicious. Will be eating here everyday while I’m in town for the next few days.
The best restaurant in Ljubliana. A happy place too! Very nice food, waiters truly gentle and good ambient.

This place is really famous. Unfortunately, the quality dropped in the last time. We ordered a plate and we got much less pieces on comparing wirh portions a couple of years  ago. Also the quality was not on high level. Good location, ambient, but the quality of the food varies.
Great ambient, excellent food. Just like it was 20 years ago. This place certainly is a time capsule of quisine, service and ambient from a different era. One of my favorite places.
Excellent food. Outstanding service. Great interior

In hot summertime this place shoud be rated with 6 stars for their location alone; the pleasant tree-shade and refreshing coolness of their open garden make this restaurant one of the most enjoyable places in Ljubljana. And the food is quite good too, especially if you stick to what they do best - Balkan cuisine and various grilled meat-dishes.
Have been coming here all my life. Food has always been good and is the same since the first time I cam here more than 20 years ago.

Great Mexican restaurant with wide selection of Mexican food and drinks. Interior is made with touch and is a tidy place which gets updated many times so they put a lot of focus on that. It is usually crowded, but you get a table quickly. Staff there is also nice and helpful.
Lively atmosphere, fast service and absolutely delicious food! The only thing I'd mark down are the high prices.

It's a restaurant that serves Mexican food. Reservations aren't required. Service is fast and polite. I loved their drinks menu with tasty margaritas and mojitos. Interior is simple, lights are dimmed and they play latino music. Toilet was clean. They accept cash and credit card. The place is nice, food is tasty, portions are quite large.

A well designed restaurant with a friendly and professional staff. The location in the city center it top notch. Perhaps a bit overpriced for the quality of the food witch is on par with other nearby mexican restaurants.
It has very good food but it will cost you a lot of money.

Crowded but still you can get a place anytime. Restaurant also have indoor  playgrounds for kids. And small size pets are allowed.  don't know how they manage it but they are doing good :-) Very good food at reasonable price. Staff is kind and helpful. Recommended.
This was my first time here but definitely not last. We were starving and the service was super fast. The food very tasty. Prices medium/low for their huge portions. I recommend this place!!!

They are crowded all the time, especially during the weekends. It's recommended to do the reservation. It's a good place for groups, birthday party, baby shower, etc. Food portions are big, and food is inexpensive (especially fried food). But they still have good salads, pizzas, etc
I liked the food. The prices are decent. Its smoker friendly and my female colleges liked the vaiters xD. Its popular so its almost always crowded (not in a bad way).

Great pizzas. Only minus is, even if you book a table, it can happen that the place is overcrowded and they do not have a table that you reserved. If you know how to talk and make pressure on them, they will provide you with the table. There is also a place for kids to play in the restaurant. Prices are decent.

Delicious pizza, well priced and good service. There is outdoor seating near the river available too if the weather is decent.
Had the margherita, base was delicious and crisp, but not burnt. Cheese was decent, though could have done with more mozzarella IMO.
Great place!
The staff are very friendly and the pizzas are excellent. Great value for money. Nice and quiet environment. Highly recommended.
Great pizza with an amazing view of the river, don't forget to ask for a good draught beer!
What an unexpected nice restaurant! AWESOME food and the stuff was very nice!
One of the best pizzas in the city. Waiters look depressed, exhausted... just for that reason 4/5.
The place is very disappointing. The waiters are in a rush, forcing you to order fast even that you haven't seen the menu and the staff is making you feel unpleasant!
Food was amazing. The service was awesome. I reccomend you visit, you wont regret it.

Ordered goulash, spiced pork sausage, and pork roast for the table. Meals were very nice. Nothing to write home about, but nothing at all to fault. Service was OK, waiter very pleasant, wait time was a bit delayed given total number of patrons.

I am giving one star, because there is no option for less!!!! 
The waiters were rushed, ordering behalf our name, and telling us things like “ Cam-on we are waiting 100 people what do you want” or “is thus the first time in a restaurant ?” literally less than a minute after they gave us the menu!! 
I let that pass by because of the place reputation, but the food was nothing special, way too salty and again during the time we ate the waiters were in a rush! This is definitely not a nice place ti eat!!!
I have enjoyed stay there. Taste food, fast staff, reasonable price. Recommend

Authenthic Chinese cuisine! Tastes incredible!
Might take a while sometimes and you should be careful what you order, which means that some of the food is simply boring and not that authenthic when most of it is incredibly awesome!
Classic Chinese restaurant. Waitress speaks perfect English. The crispy duck was delicious.
Very good place. Amazing food. They serve you well, and very helpful. I would come here again. And again. And... Again!
Delicious food, quick service, not absurdly expensive.
Small place, great location and tasty food.
Great lunch meals !
Very good food and cosy atmosphere.
Nice garden, good food.
Nice place, good food

It was recommended by the hostel, the service was very friendly but the food is  a bit expensive and not that good as a expacted. I had a white wine, Idrija zlikrofi with balkalca-lamb ragout and as a dessert prekmurje layered pastry. The dessert was the best.

The place really has an upscale feel to. Calm, friendly and relaxing environment, great for a couple or a small social gathering, either for business or for pleasure. Service is top notch as well. The food is good, but because it is an upscale place I expected a bit more. I do however recommend that you at least try it and see if it suits you.

Ths is an upscale restaurant serving generous portions of tasty food. The service was relatively smooth, waiters were helpful offering advise, although it was obvious that they were in a hurry. The tables are relatively close to each other without much "fences", so we could easily hear the conversation over the next table. I would advise you to enjoy this great  restaurant in the off-season.

Lovely restaurant with very delicious food, great service and excellent ambient. Stuff was also incredible, even without a reservation we got the table in the rush hour, and i think they speak all the languages from the world :)

Everything was so perfect that i can't imagine any detail which could improve entire experience.
Amazing food, excelent stuff. One of the best restaurants in Ljubljana.

Always proffesional, always great food and top proffesional attitude from the staff ant the owner. Great tuna carpaccio, great sea bass from the oven. Very large choice of vines. Surely one of the best eats in Ljubljana.
Great dish food and entries, but not so good a personnel (except the owner) and lack something with deserts.
Restaurant that specializes in seafood. Decent.
Good fish restaurant. Prices are quite high.
Super
Še kar dobra gostilna.... malo manjša izbira hrane za otroke.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.  A great experience overall.  Najc was my server and he was excellent.  The food was unique and showcased the region's cuisine very nicely.

One of the best meals I've had in years. The service was wonderful and the food and flavors were spot on. No detail was overlooked. Truly spectacular all around.

P.S. I highly recommend the local wines and the smoked olive oil.

We are here for Christmas Day dinner and couldn't be happier with the outcome! I had the 6 course meat menu and my partner had the 6 course fish menu. Both were fantastic and of an international standard! We also had the matched wines which were matched perfectly, displaying some of the less internationally known Slovenian wines. 

The service was also professional, knowledgeable and very friendly! 

The decor is not overly impressive but does have a traditional charm to it. 

If you like fine food I highly recommend you give it a visit.

Delicious food - came here for dinner on Saturday and had the tasting menu (four courses and you could get dessert). Was initially underwhelmed by the decor and dated background music but soon discovered that this was a true local gem. Every course was beautifully presented and tasted divine. Service was impeccable. Reservations a good idea, the restaurant was full. Would highly recommend.

Manna restaurant is incredible. Firstly the staff are just so friendly and so attentive, talking you through the foods and wines, and just generally being so incredible. Then the food, simply incredible, very well thought out and incredible flavours, a true adventure of taste. I have been visiting Ljubljana each year for a while and always come to Manna during my stay for such a special experience at a very good price. Could not recommend highly enough. Love Manna.
I have had one of the best dinners in my life there. I would highly recommend this place.
Authentic ambient with a quite good food.
vegan food, yeah, very delicious. I often meet people here to talk. I look forward to a return visit. This place has a cool feel to it. Ambience reminds me of Colorado Springs area.

A total safe haven for plant-based people. Feels like a commune. No frills vegan Indian restaurant with all-you-can-eat buffet for $8. Tons of veggies, leafy greens and gluten free foods. We dined in due to heavy rain. Can't wait to sit on their front patio and enjoy their baked goods with a beverage.
Great location for quality Vegan food. Got there near seven, it wasn't very crowded. The service was very welcoming and observant.
Good location for vegan food. The service here is above par. The bill was good for how much you get. Menu is similar to a restaurant in El Paso I liked.
My fav location for delicious Vegan food. Went there on a Saturday. The place has a good atmosphere.

If you like a more alternative style this is totally the place for you. The artwork is absolutely amazing! The bars are unique and the vibe is awesome. If you want to be alone it's totally feasible, especially during the day, but if you want company, people are very friendly.

This community is super cool full of art that can get some inspiration from it! You will be amazed by how delicate how creative the work is, in the meanwhile, the material they use, the color they match is quite particular! I can say I visited to this city one big reason is for this community, and better with your camera with you as some part is quite dark for phone!

An interesting place inside the city, and pretty close to the train main station. 
It's one of three tiny independent spots inside three European capitals. My aim to visit the other two and just compare how each one of these has started, developed, and what kind of challenges they have to continue being existed. In case of Metelkova, the government already did many attempts to clean the place and bring the settlers out, but they were obviously unsuccessful.

Absolutely gorgeous exhibition of street art and a great place to wander around. You could spend hours here taking in every available detail on the walls and buildings all around you. Additionally the location of Metelkova seemed to inspire general street art so make sure to wander through the entire area and not just this.
Really cool, just know that people smoke there, but usually they understand this is a touristic place. I love the art here
